an3.110:4.1: Seated to one side, the Buddha said to the householder Anāthapiṇḍika:
an3.110:4.2: “Householder, when the mind is fallen, bodily, verbal, and mental deeds are fallen.
an3.110:4.3: Someone whose deeds of body, speech, and mind are fallen will not have a good death.
an3.110:4.4: It’s like a bungalow with a bad roof. The roof peak, rafters, and walls fall in.
an3.110:4.5: In the same way, when the mind is fallen, bodily, verbal, and mental deeds are fallen.
an3.110:4.6: Someone whose deeds of body, speech, and mind are fallen will not have a good death.
an3.110:5.1: When the mind is not fallen, bodily, verbal, and mental deeds are not fallen.
an3.110:5.2: Someone whose deeds of body, speech, and mind are not fallen will have a good death.
an3.110:5.3: It’s like a bungalow with a good roof. The roof peak, rafters, and walls are not fallen in.
an3.110:5.4: In the same way, when the mind is not fallen, bodily, verbal, and mental deeds are not fallen.
an3.110:5.5: Someone whose deeds of body, speech, and mind are not fallen will have a good death.”
